# Building Plan Minimum Submission Requirements

You must apply for your permit using PLUS. Plans must clearly illustrate the nature of all of the work to be performed.

  * Minimum scale of 1/8 inch = 1 foot for commercial, minimum scale of 1/4 inch = 1 foot for residential
  * Code year used for the design.
  * Name, address and occupation of the building designer.
  * If prepared by a Virginia registered architect or professional engineer, the plans must contain an embedded digital signature, seal and date. **For details on when a signature and seal is required, please seeSigned and Sealed Drawings.**
  * Project name, address of the building.



# Commercial construction

  * Completed Building Plan Review Cover Sheet.
  * For structural work, a completed Statement of Special Inspections.



For additional information, see project specific information on Commercial Construction.

#  Residential construction

  * Building Plan Review Cover Sheet
  * Wall bracing method and worksheet. For more information, see our Wall Bracing publications.
  * Insulation R-values and U-factors. See our Energy Conservation publication for specific requirements.
  * Residential Truss Shop Drawings



For additional information, see project specific information on Residential Construction.

  
Need Help? Call **703-222-0801** , **TTY 711**.

Monday through Thursday from 8 a.m. to 4 p.m. and Friday from 9:15 a.m. to 4 p.m.

  * LDS Permit Library: Access guides to navigate every record type in PLUS.
  * Letters to Industry: Subscribe for LDS announcements, notices, and tech bulletins.
  * Meet With Staff: Find a staff member to help you with the permit process.
